description: Metrics from Minigun HTTP Benchmark tool.

panels.description: Full time of every request starting from the beginning (DNS query) and ending with receiving full response.
panels.title: Full request time

panels.description: Time since request headers and body are sent and until the full response received.
panels.title: Response time

panels.description: Time required to write request body to the remote endpoint.
panels.title: Write request body duration

panels.description: Time from the beginning of request till the first byte of response is received.
panels.title: Time to first byte

panels.description:
The length of the tasks queue in Minigun benchmark tool.

Ideally this should be zero all the time. If you get constant high value here, then it means Minigun worker(s) can't run HTTP requests at the desired rate which could be caused by the target endpoint slowness or by the lack of Minigun resources/workers. Try increasing the workers count in your Minigun benchmark and make sure they have enough CPU.
panels.title: Task queue length

panels.description:
The number of task queue full events.

Ideally this should be zero all the time. If you get constant high value here, then it means Minigun worker(s) can't run HTTP requests at the desired rate which could be caused by the target endpoint slowness or by the lack of Minigun resources/workers. Try increasing the workers count in your Minigun benchmark and make sure they have enough CPU.
panels.title: Task queue full events

panels.description: This should be 0% all the time. If it's not, it means Minigun workers are throttled and benchmark result will be affected by it.
panels.title: CPU throttle rate

title: Kubernetes: Minigun HTTP Benchmark
